docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Python codeblocks
docs.text:
def sum(a, b):
    answer = a + b
    return answer

docs.title: Yaml codeblocks
docs.text:
palette:  
    - media: "(prefers-color-scheme: light)" 
      scheme: default 
      primary: blue grey 
      accent: indigo 
      toggle: 
        icon: material/brightness-7 
        name: Switch to dark mode

    answer = a * b
    return answer

    return answer

docs.title: Material for MKDocs gettting started
docs.text: Learn how to create and host a documentation site using Material for MkDocs on GitHub Pages in a step-by-step guide. Youtube link

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: Python VSCode Github

docs.title: Configuration validation and auto-complete(Recommended)
docs.text:
Add the text to vscode settings.json 

{
  "yaml.schemas": {
      "https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/schema.json": "mkdocs.yml"
  },
  "yaml.customTags": [ 
      "!ENV scalar",
      "!ENV sequence",
      "!relative scalar",
      "tag:yaml.org,2002:python/name:material.extensions.emoji.to_svg",
      "tag:yaml.org,2002:python/name:material.extensions.emoji.twemoji",
      "tag:yaml.org,2002:python/name:pymdownx.superfences.fence_code_format"
  ]
}

docs.title: Make github repository
docs.text: Create a repository to manage your documents.

docs.title: Clone repository
docs.text: Clone your repository in the location you want to work in.

docs.title: Create a virtual environment
docs.text: Create a virtual environment for your mkdocs project.

docs.title: MKDocs install
docs.text:
Install material for mkdocs
pip install mkdocs-material

docs.title: Make MKDocs project(mkdocs new .)
docs.text:
To create a project, at the command line, type mkdocs new . (where you want to create the project). Make MKDocs project

mkdocs new .

docs.title: Set mkdocs.yml
docs.text: Modify the mkdocs.yml inside your project if you need to change settings or add functionality.

docs.title: Make docs
docs.text: If you create an MD file inside the docs folder of your project, the service will automatically reflect it when it runs.

docs.title: Run MKDocs
docs.text:
Run the service by typing mkdocs serve at the command line (default port is 8000). 

mkdocs serve

docs.title: Deploy(Use github action)
docs.text:
1. Make directory .github/workflows
  2. Make file ci.yml
  3. Input code ci.yml 
     name: ci 
 on:
   push:
     branches:
       - master 
       - main
 permissions:
   contents: write
 jobs:
   deploy:
     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
     steps:
       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
       - name: Configure Git Credentials
         run: |
           git config user.name github-actions[bot]
           git config user.email 41898282+github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com
       - uses: actions/setup-python@v4
         with:
           python-version: 3.x
       - run: echo "cache_id=$(date --utc '+%V')" >> $GITHUB_ENV 
       - uses: actions/cache@v3
         with:
           key: mkdocs-material-${{ env.cache_id }}
           path: .cache
           restore-keys: |
             mkdocs-material-
       - run: pip install mkdocs-material 
       - run: mkdocs gh-deploy --force

docs.title: What if I want to adjust the order of the MD files after creating them?
docs.text:
Add the nav attribute to the top-level depth in Medics.yml. nav attribute in mkdocs.yml

nav:
  - index.md 
  - getting_started.md
  - example.md
You can name the MD files in any order you want, as shown above, and they will be reflected in the webpage in that order. In addition, the MD files are titled in the webpage based on the titles in the markdown.
